alert.note: Alert for Davis (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued September 18 at 7:14PM CDT until September 19 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DAVIS COUNTY... At 714 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Pulaski, or 5 miles east of Bloomfield, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Davis County, including the following locations... Pulaski. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
